meanings.definition: The bottom edge of a garment, such as a skirt or dress.
meanings.sent1: She carefully adjusted the hemline of her skirt before the party.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer decided to raise the hemline of the dress for a modern look.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tugged on the hemline of the tablecloth, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the hemline of the clouds turned a beautiful shade of pink.
meanings.sent5: The hemline of the ocean met the sky in a perfect horizon.

meanings.definition: To alter the length of a garment by folding and sewing the edge.
meanings.sent1: She hemlined her pants to make them fit better.
meanings.sent2: The tailor hemlined the dress to make it shorter for the customer.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally hemlined his shirt too short, making it look funny.
meanings.sent4: The seamstress skillfully hemlined the curtains to the perfect length.
meanings.sent5: Hemlining a skirt requires precision and attention to detail.
